str2: Immoderate, boastful, excessive, pompous. From huper and ogkos; bulging over, i.e. insolent.
From mataios; inutility; figuratively, transientness; morally, depravity.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To speak aloud, utter. Probably akin to pheggos and thus to phemi; to utter a clear sound, i.e. to proclaim.
From a compound of a and a presumed selges; licentiousness.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To allure, entice (by a bait). From the base of dolos; to entrap, i.e. delude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To flee from, escape. From apo and pheugo; to escape.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and strepho; to overturn; also to return; by implication, to busy oneself, i.e. Remain, live.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Feminine of planos; objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety.
